H0.text: Periodic dimming of the stars provides evidence of the existence of planets orbiting other stars.

H1.text: Periodic Xâ€‘ray bursts from the stars provide evidence of the existence of planets orbiting other stars.

H2.text: Rapid location changes of the stars provide evidence of the existence of planets orbiting other stars.

H3.text: Regular spectrum changes from the stars provide evidence of the existence of planets orbiting other stars.

A4.text: Both CoRoT and Kepler have measured the reflected light from planets. However, these planets were already known since they transit their host star.

A5.text: The radial velocity can be deduced from the displacement in the parent star's spectral lines due to the Doppler effect.

A6.text: COROT and Kepler were space missions dedicated to searching for extrasolar planets using transits.
